result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas B Dunaway

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas B Dunaway not in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Thomas B Dunaway.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Court will have another order on NGI completed. Minutes filed.

Defendant Thomas B Dunaway not in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Thomas B Dunaway.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Also present in court. NGI plea facility in Racine County. Requests another 45 days to complete assessment with evaluator. State asks for 30 days. If defendant does not show up next appointment, court will grant States request as inpatient evaluation. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to the Court from Behavioral Consultants dated 8/25/22

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas B Dunaway not in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Thomas B Dunaway. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Victim(s) have been given notice of hearing. Defendant still at Liberty Willow. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter from Behavioral consultants requesting extension on evaluation
*Request granted. DSJ

Letter from Behavioral Consultants requesting an extension on evaluation
*Court's response - I'll grant the extension. Either we can move the 7/15 court date or we can use that court date to set the new one.DSJ

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas B Dunaway
Current: 1825 Holmes Ave, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 641 E Cravath St, Whitewater, WI 53190
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.A.W. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas B Dunaway in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Thomas B Dunaway. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Unger-Keizer, argument granted. Not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect entered. Court orders exam pursuant to Sec. 971.16. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
AIA scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
